page.title: 16MOULSHAM LODGE CHELMSFORD
page.content: Moulsham Lodge is a residential housing Estate,built between 1956 and 1968, when the southern suburbs of Chelmsford were being developed.The Estate contains around 1685 homes. The Estate takes its name from the 18th.century house called{Moulsham {Lodge}which stands just to the north of the estate.This was the lodge house for the much larger{Moulsham Hall} which was the home of the {Mildmay {family.}Moulsham Hall no longer exists. The land on which the houses now stand was once farmed by Moulsham Lodge and, before that, was part of the Mildmay family estate. The modern housing estate covers an area approximately one km. long by half a kilometre wide. The Estate has its own parade of seventeen varied shops.
